dn6:4.3: This basically a textbook example of how not to do your job. Take orders too literally, being inflexible and uncompassionate. Then when given good advice, respond gracelessly, concerned only to avoid possible repercussions. so you fob it off on a junior, so they get any fallback, while you skirt responsibility. No wonder Nagita got replaced!
dn6:6.2: RD’s translation of this passage is much more satisfactory than MW’s.
dn6:15.3: Contra MW, text does not say both were paribbajaka. Again, RD is more accurate.
dn6:16.9: Take care of quote nesting: MS is wrong.
